intro: Matricaria atrata, commonly known as the black chamomile, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers, which contrast with its gray-green leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands. Its flowers are composed of both inner and outer layers of petals, with the inner petals being more prominent. Matricaria atrata is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
